abstract: Supreme Court ruling that Texas abortion law was unconstitutional will prevent threatened shutdown of clinics in some states, but could also create wave of legal challenges, including to laws restricting  abortions with medication or that ban certain surgical methods; anti-abortion groups are angry over decision, and vow to press on.

headline.print_headline: Abortion Ruling Could Create Waves of Legal Challenges
headline.main: Abortion Ruling Could Create Waves of Legal Challenges

snippet: Monday’s Supreme Court ruling that a Texas abortion law was unconstitutional will prevent the threatened shutdown of clinics in some states, many of which have been operating in a legal limbo.
lead_paragraph: Monday’s Supreme Court ruling that a Texas abortion law was unconstitutional will prevent the threatened shutdown of clinics in some states, many of which have been operating in a legal limbo.
